ARABIC: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يُسْـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦٓ إِنسٌ وَلَا جَآنٌّ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: That Day no man or jinn will be asked about his sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Neither man nor jinn will be questioned on that day about his sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: On that Day there will be no need to ask either men or jinn about their sins.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: On that day there will be no need to ask mankind or jinn about his sin
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: On that day no sinner will be questioned about his sins, from men or from jinns.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So, on that Day he will not be questioned about his sin, (neither) human nor Jinn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So on that day neither man nor jinni shall be asked about his sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: on that day none shall be questioned about his sin, neither man nor jinn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: On that day neither man nor jinni will be questioned of his sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: For, on that Day, neither man nor jinn will be questioned about his sins.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Of his sin will be questioned that Day neither man nor jinn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: On that day neither humans will be questioned about their sins nor jinn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: On that Day no question will be asked of man or Jinn as to his sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So on that Day no question will be asked of man or jinn as to his sin, (because they have already been known from their faces either white or black).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: On that Day, neither human nor jinn shall be asked about his sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: On that Day, no human and no jinn will be asked about his sins.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then on that Day none will be asked about his sin among men or jinn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [55:39] Thus on that day no man will be questioned about his sin, nor any jinn, about his sin; but they are questioned on some other occasion: By your Lord, We shall question them all [Q.15:92] (al-jānn in this instance and in what will follow denotes the jinn, and also in both cases al-ins denotes human beings).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: On that day) which is the Day of Judgement; after the end of reckoning (neither man nor jinn will be questioned of his sin) his works; the believer will be known with his blooming, white face; it is also said that this means: the sins of human beings and the jinn will not be asked about.
